meanings.definition: A piece of material, typically metal or wood, thick at one end and tapering to a thin edge, that is driven between two objects or parts of an object to secure or separate them.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a wedge to separate the stuck pieces of wood.
meanings.sent2: She hammered the wedge gently to secure the door in place.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorn stash under the wedge.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a wedge, driving a rift between the friends.
meanings.sent5: The bright orange wedge stood out against the dark table.

meanings.definition: A golf club with a heavy, angled head and a lofted face, used for hitting short, high shots.
meanings.sent1: He chose the wedge to make a precise shot onto the green.
meanings.sent2: The golfer's favorite club was always the trusty wedge.
meanings.sent3: The comical penguin tried to use the golf wedge to fish in the icy water.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a wedge, lifting everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The golden wedge gleamed under the bright sun on the course.

meanings.definition: To force open or apart with a wedge.
meanings.sent1: She carefully wedges the window open to let in fresh air.
meanings.sent2: The locksmith wedged the door to gain entry into the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat wedged itself into the tiny box and got stuck.
meanings.sent4: His determination wedged open new opportunities for him.
meanings.sent5: The idea of traveling the world wedges itself into her mind, urging her to explore.
